hypothesis_content.title: Asia Session Liquidity Void Breakout Fakeout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, a pre-Asia-session breakout (10PM-2AM UTC) on below-average volume (<70% of 20-day average for that window) that fails to sustain above the 15-min Bollinger Band (20,2) upper band by the London open (8AM UTC) provides a high-probability mean-reversion short entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Asia session often has thinner liquidity, allowing for exaggerated moves. A low-volume breakout is suspect. The London open brings increased volume and more efficient price discovery. Failure to hold the breakout as London participants enter is a strong rejection signal.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above 15-min BB(20,2) upper band between 10PM-2AM UTC
Volume during breakout window < 70% of 20-day average for same window
Trigger: Price closes back INSIDE the BB upper band on a 15-min candle by 8AM UTC (London open)
Entry: Market sell order on BTC perpetuals on that confirming candle close

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains >1% above the BB upper band for two consecutive 15-min candles post-London open

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Win rate of fade trades < 60%, or median loss per trade > median gain per trade, over a sample of 50+ instances.
